title: How to Whitelist an Email Address Quickly

steps.title: Go to https://mail.google.com/.
steps.content: Go to https://mail.google.com/ . This is the official website for Gmail. [1] X Research source Note that you can't create a filter in the Gmail app. This method needs to be done from the Gmail desktop website.

steps.title: Click the settings button.
steps.content: Click the settings button. It's a gray gear in the top right of the Gmail website.

steps.title: Click See all settings.
steps.content: Click See all settings .

steps.title: Click Filters and Blocked Addresses.
steps.content: Click Filters and Blocked Addresses . This is a tab in the settings menu.

steps.title: Click Create a new filter.
steps.content: Click Create a new filter .

steps.title: Enter the email address you want to whitelist in the "From" field.
steps.content: Enter the email address you want to whitelist in the "From" field. You can enter multiple emails if needed.

steps.title: Click Create filter.
steps.content: Click Create filter . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select "Never send it to Spam" and click Create filter.
steps.content: Select "Never send it to Spam" and click Create filter . You're done! The email addresses you listed are now whitelisted. Emails from the address won't be sent to the Spam folder. You're ready to continue sending emails , creating new labels, and deleting spam. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Go to https://outlook.live.com/mail/0/.
steps.content: Go to https://outlook.live.com/mail/0/ . This is the official Microsoft Outlook website. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click the settings button.
steps.content: Click the settings button. It's the white gear in the top right of the Outlook website.

steps.title: Click View all Outlook settings.
steps.content: Click View all Outlook settings .

steps.title: Click Mail and then Junk Mail.
steps.content: Click Mail and then Junk Mail . These options are in the left menu of the settings window.

steps.title: Click + Add under "Safe senders and domains."
steps.content: Click + Add under "Safe senders and domains." This will open a text box for entering in email addresses.

steps.title: Type in the email address you want to whitelist and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type in the email address you want to whitelist and press ↵ Enter . This will add the email address to the Safe Senders List, meaning emails from the address won't be sent to the Junk folder. You can also block a contact if needed.

steps.title: Click the Home tab.
steps.content: Click the Home tab. This is at the top of the desktop app for Outlook.

steps.title: Click Junk.
steps.content: Click Junk . This is a person icon with a red circle icon. [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Select Junk E-mail Options.
steps.content: Select Junk E-mail Options . This is in the Junk drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click the Safe Senders tab.
steps.content: Click the Safe Senders tab. It's at the top of the "Junk Email Options" window. [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Add.
steps.content: Click Add . A new window will appear for entering an email address. [7] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Type the email address that you want to whitelist and press OK.
steps.content: Type the email address that you want to whitelist and press OK . This will add the email to the Safe Senders list and prevent it from being sent to the Junk folder.

steps.title: Press OK to confirm your changes.
steps.content: Press OK to confirm your changes. This is at the bottom of the "Junk Email Options" window.

steps.title: Click Mail and then Settings.
steps.content: Click Mail and then Settings . This is in the menu bar when the Mail app is open. This method creates a new custom rule to prevent mail from certain addresses from being sent to the Junk folder. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Click Rules.
steps.content: Click Rules . This will take you to the rules page for Apple Mail.

steps.title: Click Add Rule.
steps.content: Click Add Rule . [9] X Research source

steps.title: Type a name for the rule.
steps.content: Type a name for the rule. This can be something like "Whitelist" or "Safe Senders."

steps.title: Set the criteria for the rule.
steps.content: Set the criteria for the rule. The following parameters will allow you to whitelist emails: Select Any for the "following conditions are met" section. Select From in the sending/receiving drop-down. Select Ends With in the drop-down next to From . Type the email address you want to whitelist in the text box next to Ends With . Press the + button to add additional email addresses.

steps.title: Set the action for the rule.
steps.content: Set the action for the rule. This is what will prevent the email from being sent to the Junk folder: Select Move Message in the "Perform the following actions" section. Select Inbox as the destination folder.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . This will confirm the new whitelist rule.

steps.title: Go to https://mail.yahoo.com/.
steps.content: Go to https://mail.yahoo.com/ . This is the official website for Yahoo mail. Log in if you aren't already. You can change your password if needed. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It has a blue gear icon.

steps.title: Click More Settings.
steps.content: Click More Settings . This will open a new window with the full settings options. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Click Filters.
steps.content: Click Filters .

steps.title: Click Add new filters.
steps.content: Click Add new filters . This will prompt you to enter information about the new filter. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Enter a name for the filter.
steps.content: Enter a name for the filter. This could be something like "allowed senders list."

steps.title: Add the email address you want to whitelist.
steps.content: Add the email address you want to whitelist.

steps.title: Select the rule that sends all emails from the listed address to the Inbox.
steps.content: Select the rule that sends all emails from the listed address to the Inbox. This will effectively whitelist the emails and prevent them from being sent to the spam folder.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . This will confirm the filter and whitelist the listed emails.

steps.title: Go to https://mail.aol.com/.
steps.content: Go to https://mail.aol.com/ . This is the official website for AOL Mail. To whitelist emails, you just need to add them to your AOL contacts. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Click Contacts.
steps.content: Click Contacts . This is in the left menu of the AOL Mail website.

steps.title: Click New Contact.
steps.content: Click New Contact . [14] X Research source

steps.title: Type in the contact information for the email address you want to whitelist.
steps.content: Type in the contact information for the email address you want to whitelist.

steps.title: Click Add Contact.
steps.content: Click Add Contact . This will save the contact and whitelist the email address, preventing it from being sent to the spam folder. [15] X Research source If your AOL Mail hasn't been working correctly, you can try resetting to the default settings to potentially resolve the issue.
